item.title: Project 1: Exploratory Data Analysis
item.description: 3 separate datasets were used to create the final dataset. The first is in the package Ecdat, and is called “breaches”. This dataset was created by the US Department of Health and Human Services. There are many variables in this dataset, but for my analysis, only ‘State’ was used. Another variable was created called ‘Cyber’ that summed up the total number of security breaches by state. The second dataset used was “USstateAbbreviations” in order to convert the 2 letter stae code from the “breaches” dataset into the full name of the state.

item.title: My New Post
item.description: Put something in here. #this is a python code chunk print("hello world!") ## hello world! x="dog" library(reticulate) #this is a R code chunk py$x ## [1] "dog" y<-2 r.y+1 == 3 ## True

item.title: Project 2: Modeling, Testing, and Predicting
item.description: library(mosaicData) ?Gestation gestation <- Gestation gestation <- gestation %>% mutate(gest=gestation, parwt=(wt.1+dwt)/2, smoke=ifelse(smoke==0, 1, 0)) %>% select(gest, wt, parwt, inc, smoke) %>% na.omit() nrow(Gestation) ## [1] 1236 637*5 ## [1] 3185 This Gestation Dataset is from a study examining the link between different factors and male health at birth. The first variable is ‘gest’. This variable is numeric and measures the length of gestation in days. The second variable is ‘wt’.

item.title: Projects
